key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris has recently lost two senior aides, Ashley Etienne and Symone Sanders.
Departures are said to be long-planned, not indicative of internal issues.
Questions arise regarding stability within Harris' team due to these senior-level exits.
Critics argue Harris faces unfair scrutiny due to her historic vice-presidential role.
Reports suggest dysfunction and a lack of focus within Harris' staff, as well as tensions with the White House.
Harris reportedly feels constrained and sidelined, impacting her political maneuverability.
Past reports indicate issues with low morale and distrust among Harris' staff.
Harris' struggle with staff retention is noted as a recurring issue, even during her time as California attorney general.
Previous settlements in the California Department of Justice for harassment allegations were made under Harris' leadership, claims she was unaware of.
Vice-presidential role described as inherently diminishing, contributing to challenges in maintaining public and political stature.
spokespersons: Mark Z. Barabak (Los Angeles Times political reporter)
